summary:
I am a consultant inspired by a love for epidemiology and interest in diseases. I have been professionally trained in epidemiology in the Netherlands (MSc, PhD) after which I moved to South Africa. I am working as an epidemiology consultant, assisting a range of organisations with literature and data reviews, publication writing and editing, and curriculum development and teaching. Since December 2021 I am based again in the Netherlands. 

I have several years of professional experience in HIV/AIDS programming, evaluation and quantitative research as an independent consultant, and have worked for several UN and other international agencies (The Global Fund, UNICEF, UNAIDS, Gates Foundation, WHO, USAID). I am involved in different projects, going from prevention to the cascade of care. This includes HIV/AIDS programmes (funding and research) proposal writing, HIV epidemiology and program reviews, evaluating programs for people living with HIV, promoting the use of HIV data to improve practice including developing various HIV-related cascades. 

I have worked in the following countries: South Africa (2007-2021), Swaziland (2012, 2013), Tanzania (2012-2014), Mozambique (2014), Uganda (2018), Botswana (2018, 2019), Angola (2011), Nepal (2014), but have also worked with stakeholders in many other countries as well. 

My key competences are: Professional enthusiasm; Knowledgeable; Pragmatic; Thorough; Responsive; Deliver within short timeframes; High quality work; Going the extra mile.

Recent projects:

HIV prevention consultant for The Global Fund (Geneva), June 2021 – Ongoing: Working on a Theory of Change, Results Framework and M&E Framework for HIV prevention within the organisation; analysis of HIV prevention related results arising from investments; providing inputs in NFM4 application materials (HIV information note, Modular Framework, Performance Framework, Gap tables).

WHO Geneva, February 2021 – Ongoing [May 2023]: Scoping of existing literature and good practice examples from countries on person-centred monitoring of HIV prevention services to inform the 2022 WHO Strategic Information Guidelines. Providing editorial support for the finalization of these guidelines. 

Solutions Advisor: Evaluation & Epidemiologist at Panagora Group, June 2019 – Ongoing: Assisting USAID/South Africa with various smaller and larger assignments related to data analysis and use. Currently the focus is on providing Strategic Information support COVID-19 including quarterly progress reporting for GLOBALVAX).

profile_positions.description:
In October 2008 I started Epi Result, a firm offering research consultancy (research proposal writing, statistical data analysis, writing publications, reviewing methods) and teaching (courses, curriculum development).

Some past projects:

Consultant for the Global HIV Prevention Coalition, October 2019-December 2021:  working on e.g. an aide for comprehensive service packages for adolescent girls and young women (AGYW); condom situation analyses; reviewing guidance documents for Key Populations (unique identifier codes; programmatic mapping and population size estimates; programmatic monitoring); prevention scorecards for Coalition countries. (UNAIDS Geneva)

UNAIDS / Gates Foundation, September 2019-February 2020: Developing Operational guidance for creating HIV prevention cascades, a tool for monitoring programs. Aim of the guidance document is to provide managers with assistance on how to create basic, standardized – and hence simplified - HIV prevention cascades in order to enhance their ability to monitor and improve their programming and to enable comparisons of programme effectiveness across sites. A basic HIV prevention cascade model is provided, together with modifications and practical examples for  condoms, PrEP, VMMC, needle and syringe programme, combination prevention for key populations and adolescent girls and young women (AGYW). 

Consultant for the Evaluation of the contribution of the UN Joint programme to the goals and targets in the 2016-2021 UNAIDS Strategy, August 2019-April 2020. Responsible for the Right Results chapter, including the quantitative analysis of UBRAF outputs and HIV epidemic and response indicators. Furthermore, conducted the South Africa case study and several key informant interviews. (Itad)

profile_positions.description:
Project manager of a survey on the prevalence of health problems and the utilisation of health care among more than 400 refugees and asylum seekers from Afghanistan, Iran and Somalia living in 3 major municipalities and 14 reception centres in the Netherlands. 

Main responsibilities:
1. organising the study (including design, project planning, finance)
2. development of measurement instrument
3. recruitment of participants and coordination of the data collection
4. supervising the research team (consisting of 33 interviewers from Afghanistan, Iran and Somalia) and 1 research assistant)
5. developing and conducting interview training sessions
6. maintaining contacts with relevant partners in the field 
7. data-analysis (SPSS) and reporting of the results in academic publications and a report
8. presentation of the results at (inter)national meetings
9. organising a conference meeting about the project
